The split ends were helped considerably. Being an older woman who has had her her colored many many times this was a shampoo that was surprisingly helpful despite its price. What was most noticeable to me was that her hair seemed to have more sheen than before using the product. Now I myself can't say I've used it, but for a woman that's had many hair treatments she has a pretty good estimation of how well these types of products work. I'd recommend at least sampling if you have damage from color treatments.

I got this item to see if it works even better with the Clear conditioner. I couldn't tell that much difference, but I really like both products and they make my hair very soft with a good smell. Again, I have curly hair which I color so when I find a new product that works well, it's a good day! I just wish all the hair products weren't so expensive. I recommend this product because if it works well on my hair, chances are it will on yours.

Well this shampoo is great.  First, it smells really nice without being overly perfumed.  Second, it lathers very well in my very thick hair.  Third, it cleans my very oily hair without overdrying.  Lastly, it leaves my hair looking very silky.  I have noticed a slight improvement in my dermatitis so that is an added benefit.  I got this bottle for free but I will buy one when it runs out.  And lest you wonder why I knocked off a star...it is because I am not a big fan of the spout and shape of the bottle.  It is a little akward to open and squeeze.

This shampoo does the job. It lathers well, smells pleasant, and seems to work fine. After lathering, the shampoo rinses out well and my hair feels squeaky clean. You don't have to use much shampoo...a little goes a long way. I really can't find any superlative things to say about it, it does the job without any problems. I will say that I have an issue with telling which is the shampoo and which is the conditioner because the bottles are almost identical and I always forget which is which.

I can't really tell if there is a benefit to using this on my colored hair or not. Everything seems fine with this shampoo, nothing stands out as being wonderful or awful. I did not have any leakage like other reviewers have reported with the shipping of this product. The cost is reasonable, that might be the best thing about this product.

There is a bit of a problem with these shampoo bottles that only really applies for shipping; the new pop top. I actually like the way the bottle opens during use - it's a vast improvement over smaller flip tops that are difficult to open with wet hands or those horrid little spout type bottles. Unfortunately, they don't ship well and arrived as a big mess. Fortunately, Amazon wrapped these in plastic which contained most of the mess but still about 1/4 of the bottle was gone.

Now, aside from that, I'm not a big fan of the fragrance which seems quite strong...however, my better half loves the smell of this entire line of products. As for the function, with summer in Florida and very long hair, I have sun damage especially near the ends and this does seem to help keep the friz and breakage down. Hair is smooth although perhaps just a bit heavier feeling than I'd normally like.

All in all, a nice product but open pop tops - despite the convenience when in use - leave something to be desired during extended shipping.

This product left my hair soft and shiny without being too limp or greasy looking. It has a really nice smell to it as well. It also helps with dandruff, so if you have hard water, then this would be a great product for your hair. I like this product, I would definitely buy it. I would next like to try the matching conditioner.

This shampoo has a nice scent and leaves my hair feeling very soft and smooth.I didn't find the scent to be too strong at all. The price is comparable to other brands so I will probable buy this again (although I don't recommend buying through the mail).

I love the CLEAR Conditioner and even though I received a bottle of it for review, I'll keep buying it. The difference in my hair is amazing and though I complained that I'm getting weird little tangles at my hairline, it dawned on me that that's because the product is so good. Duh!

So, since I'd used the CLEAR conditioner with my regular shampoo and getting fabulous results, I was expecting great things from the CLEAR shampoo. Alas, I've been using for about a month now and have come to the reluctant conclusion that it's merely average. It smells wonderful and gets my hair clean, but it's not making any more difference in my hair than just using the conditioner.

If you like your grooming products in matched sets, then by all means purchase away, but there's really no need. It's possible to get the CLEAR results from the conditioner alone.

The Clear Scalp & Hair Beauty Damage & Color Repair Nourishing Shampoo smells absolutely incredible!  That's what makes it 2 stars and not lower.  I have used this shampoo about 5 or 6 times and even tried different conditioners with it.  However, each time, I had trouble combing the conditioner through my hair.  Also, my scalp itched slightly after using it.  I've used one of Clear's conditioners before, and it didn't get me an itchy scalp, so there must be a different ingredient in this shampoo that my body does not like.  Once again, the smell of the shampoo is absolutely incredible -- very clean, fresh, and great; but it doesn't make up for the tangly hair and bothered scalp.

Let me share the positive first.
This is a fine shampoo. I can't say I saw anything very special about it's shampooing ability, all the promised scalp and hair benefit, but I saw no negatives either. Just does a nice job
I think it has a pleasant smell, not too strong in my opinion.
And it has a nice consistency, although the lavender color is a little strange and unnecessary.

But back to that container.
In use it is nice, wide, easy to use tilt top.
But once again (I reviewed a different variety of this brand before) the bottle leaked in transit.
Certainly a problem if you plan to buy it online. This time the top was wrapped in plastic, but it still came partially open and leaked. I guess the same factors that make it easy to use in a wet shower make it too easy to open in an Amazon box in shipping.

Okay, so I'll be the first to admit that I'm not super picky about the kind of Shampoo I use. I've been using K-PAK by Joico, but was running low. So when I saw this in the vine program I ordered it. I like the scent, and it doesn't seem to dry out my hair or scalp, so all's good.

This shampoo lathers thick and rich.  A relatively small amount made a huge amount of lather.  It's quite creamy, and it left my hair feeling quite nice and soft, not stripped.  My hair is long and thick, with a tendency towards dry ends.  This shampoo worked very well on it, and it smells fine.  The scent is not very strong, and not offensive.  The scent is not amazing, but certainly satisfactory.
nice shampoo. does a nice job in repairing and nourishing the hair.  I found it very easy on my hair. Lathered well, and rinsed out well--leaving no residual on my hair. Nice smell as well.

I was unsure what to make of this new hair care line. All of the basic ingredients are the same as my other shampoos for color-treated hair. Also, my understanding of basic health science regarding healthy hair & scalp left me skeptical that the Clear shampoo or conditioner would be much different than any other.

Many people rely on hair care products to give them healthy hair, but forget that the food you eat and the shampooing technique used are far more important. To properly shampoo hair, use the pads of your fingers, stimulate the scalp in rows of circular motions, for at least 30 seconds. This increases nutrient-rich bloodflow to the scalp to encourage healthy hair growth, as well as adequately exfoliate the scalp.

----------------

Despite my initial misgivings that this line was all hype, I still gave both the shampoo and conditioner a try.

The shampoo lathered up better than the other shampoo I had been using, so I ended up needing less of it.

It rinsed away smoothly, leaving my hair feeling strong. My other shampoo left my hair feeling a bit rough and tangled, and I had always thought this was just how colored hair felt.

I see sunflower, soybean, almond & coconut oils, as well as aloe vera, further down on the Clear ingredient list. While my other shampoo contains some fruit extracts and grape seed oil, it does not contain the soothing ingredients found in the Clear product. I do think this must be part of the difference between the two that I've experienced.

I don't have fragrance sensitivities, but I don't like when it is overwhelming. I found the fragrance to be pleasant, to me it smells like apples.

The lid design presses open with a lever-like motion, which is much easier to operate with wet hands than a flip-open cap.

The assymetrical design of the bottle is interesting to look at, but is a huge pain when the wider part is put away facing down (such as when the contents are running low). I use an over-the-shower-head wire rack for my products, and the awkward shape of this lid kept getting stuck under and around other bottles when I would try to pull it out, pulling other products out with it.

----------------

Keep in mind that shampoo is more for the scalp area of the hair, while conditioner is for the ends. This works well for this product line's image when it comes to the shampoos, but not for the conditioners. I also tried the Damage & Color Repair Conditioner, and the directions instruct the user to massage it into the scalp. This is awful, resulting in greasy hair. So be warned, if you use the conditioner as well, just use it like regular conditioner, combed through the ends of your hair, and keep it away from your scalp. When used this way, it is nice conditioner.

----------------

Overall, I was pleased with the results of using the Clear shampoo and conditioner. My hair looks nice, seems less stressed, more shiny, and styles well.

Since I color my hair, fading between treatments can become an issue, especially in the summer when I'm outside more often. I was excited about trying this product because I hoped it would slow the fading process. Unfortunately, that didn't happen. It could be that I'm looking for a miracle since probably the only thing that would keep hair well conditioned and glossy is to stick with one's natural color. On the plus side, the shampoo is pretty, pink, creamy, and scented (like strawberries).

The Clear Scalp Damage & Color Repair shampoo is a reasonably good product: it has helped to minimize split ends during use. However, after spending a small fortune on coloring, I'm loathe to use this product: it contains sodium laureth sulfate, which can fade color more rapidly than shampoos without it.

The fragrance is almost like a citrus, but a bit too cloying for my preference. The scent doesn't really linger after washing, though, which is good.

The major drawback is actually a functional design. The bottle's closure and cap doesn't avoid inadvertent opening and leaking. The product arrived, having opened during shipment, and had spilled all over the inside of the shipping box. This meant a loss of about 1/4-1/3 of the shampoo; had there been other items in the box, they would've been destroyed. A similar issue was encountered when packing it in luggage for a trip.

Perhaps I have really odd hair texture, but unlike others who have reviewed here, my hair didn't feel clean after using the shampoo. I have very fine, straight as a board hair, that has been colored with a semi-permanent color to hide the grey. It can get dry, but not overly so. I liked the smell of the shampoo., and it lathered up nicely. But after I rinsed, my hair felt greasy, as if I hadn't used shampoo at all. My scalp also felt itchy afterward. Unfortunately I think I'm going to have to keep looking for a shampoo that works for me.

My hair is dry and damaged from years of coloring and blow-drying, and this shampoo makes it feel soft and silky. And it smells so great, and leaves my hair smelling good for hours afterwards. I love it!!!

I had seen the commercial for the Clear Scalp & Hair Beauty Therapy. I was intrigued by the idea of a shampoo and conditioner working from the scalp and its claim to restore the scalp's natural moisture balance. I had never seen a product focused on the nourishing of the scalp which makes more sense than all the shampoos and conditioners of the past that are supposed to work on the ends of your hair. The past products focused more on the prevention of split ends or ending fizzy hair. I color my hair every 6 to 8 weeks, so I always purchase a color-safe shampoo and conditioner. I also liked that has vitamins and nutrients including vitamins B5, C & E, sunflower, almond, soybean, coconut oils and aloe vera.

The bottles arrived wrapped in plastic bubble wrap and did have a small amount of leakage on the shampoo bottle but the conditioner bottle was okay. I have used both the shampoo and conditioner for over a week and I like the products very much. The shampoo has a lovely lavender color and a light scent. I didn't find the scent overpowering. I like that it takes a dime size amount to get a good lather. The conditioner also works well with a small amount in your palm. Most conditioners I use require quite a bit to work through my entire head of hair. I think the conditioner is very easy to work through my hair without a lot of pulling and snagging. It feels good and it doesn't leave a heavy, greasy film on my hair. It rinses very clean. Overall, I like the products. Often in the past, most store bought shampoos begin to break my head and scalp out and neither of these products have done that. I like that both shampoo and conditioner are designed to be set in such a way that the conditioner and shampoo bottles can be set flat so that the product is always draining down towards the opening. I would recommend both of these products.

I found this shampoo good for every-day use. It's gentle but cleans thoroughly. I tried it with its companion product, Clear Scalp Hair Beauty Damage and Color Repair Nourishing Conditioner (how's that for a long name?) and found they work well together. The shampoo is a little less effective at adding body than some other shampoos, and overall I like the conditioner better than the shampoo. But I have very fine, curly hair that's temperamental, so another person might not have the same experience. All in all, I'd say this product is worth a try.

Many times , I'm skeptical , I'm mean it's shampoo. How revolutionary can it be ? WRONG ! I truly felt a difference after finishing the bottle (which really lasted a long time). I don't use hair coloring , but years of styling products (mostly gel) have damaged my hair.
Clear scalp and hair beauty was a refreshing addition to my morning ritual.

I'm getting up there in years so my hair is turning into that wiry gray state. I've started coloring which after the first few days out of the salon has turned me into porcupine head. I've never thought much of shampoos & have usually just grabbed what's on sale. Clear Scalp & Hair Therapy has turned me into a believer. Just the smallest dab on the palm works into a frothy treatment. I love the aroma (but remember, just a dab). My hair is soft and cooperative for the first time in years.

Unfortunately, as other reviewers have mentioned, the top loosened during shipping and some leakage did occur. All in all, though, I'm very pleased with this product and would recommend.

My hair is short, regularly coloured and I use shampoo and conditioners specificly for coloured hair.
The first time I used this I didn't use a conditioner and towel dried my hair, to be able to see the effectiveness of this product.
Works up into good lather (we have very hard water) and rinses quickly.
After being towelled dry, my hair felt clean with no residue and with a light lift in volume.
This was impressive given the heat and humidity of Texas in the summer.
Smells nice, very light scent but use a small amount as a little goes a long way.
A clean light fragrance after dry, feels clean and light with no residue, a good product.

I used both the shampoo and matching conditioner, they made my hair feel clean and soft. I had no problem combing through it and there was no residue feeling left on my hair after I rinsed it out. It also smells great. I will definitely buy this product again in the future. Try them both, they work well together.

The bottle for this shampoo has an opening that you lever up when you want to put shampoo on your hair. The problem is that it also levers up easily during shipping, meaning the bottle is covered with shampoo when it arrives. Amazon did wrap the bottle in a plastic bag to limit the damage, but the manufacturer should really design a bottle that doesn't leak, or at least seal the top with plastic tape.

Clear Scalp & Hair Therapy has a strong, lingering fruity scent. Whether you like it will be a matter of taste. I color my hair, and I was hoping that a "damage and color repair" shampoo would do a good job of preserving color. I can't speak to the damage repair part, but it's not a very good color preserving shampoo. I would recommend it for someone with average, uncolored hair.

I was curious to try this after seeing a commercial about it. I am pleased with it overall - I have thick, wavy, hair down to the middle of my back with a fair amount gray up around my face. The smell is very pleasant, and my hair doesn't feel stripped after I've used it. I also don't have to use as much as I would with many shampoos. I don't wash my hair every day (more like every 3-4), so it's hard to tell about any improvement in breakage, but I do think there is a little bit. Overall, especially combined with the conditioner, I like it.

I have color treated hair and after several weeks using this shampoo I can say that it doesn't fade my hair color. I like the creamy consistency (rather than clear liquid) without leaving a greasy residue. Hair feels clean and light after washing without being too dry or dull. It also suds up well and I end up using much less than I normally do with a similar Pantene product. The drawback is that I don't detect any added benefit from the nutrium 10. I've used other salon quality shampoo that gives me thicker, more supple hair. This one doesn't - so only 4 stars.

I am really picky about my shampoos/conditioners, and was SO dubious when Amazon sent me this item to review.
I have colored, fine hair, which frizzes easily and breaks often. It grows very slowly and any harsh shampoos/conditioners will either break my hair or weigh it down and make it look dirty and lifeless.

Amazon sent me this item (Clear Scalp and Hair Beauty Damage and Color Repair Nourishing Shampoo) and the corresponding shampoo (Clear Scalp and Hair Beauty Damage and Color Repair Nourishing Conditioner).

I usually use the Nexxus damaged hair products that are found at Costco. It is expensive, even at Costco. But it didn't weigh my hair down nor cause breakage.

This shampoo and conditioner smells GREAT. I usually don't notice the scents, unless they are gross or medicinal, because my sense of smell is limited. But this one smells really great, like fruity flowers.

I use it basically like everyone--shampoo, rinse, condition, let sit for a minute and rinse.

Here is where it's different: When I comb out my hair, which is longer than shoulder length, it doesn't pull, tangle, or (on the other end of the spectrum) feel greasy or heavy. It combs out sleekly (is that a word?) and as my hair dries naturally, it's not frizzy or lifeless--it shows off my natural curls. If I dry it with the blowdryer, it doesn't frizz at all. I can flat iron it, and maybe because it really allows the hair to curl naturally, it takes a bit more work to get that curl out, but it looks GREAT.

I have been using it for a month now, and my hair dresser actually noticed a difference in my hair. She said that it grew more than usual (she's been doing my hair for 3 years now, every 6 weeks). I believe that because my hair doesn't break or frizz, my hair really is "growing" faster because it's not breaking off.

I didn't think that any line could replace my Nexxus, but this has. It took me a long time to find the Nexxus--with my sensitive hair that breaks so easily... And it saves me money, too, which is a great thing, especially in this economy.

Let me say right up front that I haven't noticed any real change in my hair. It hasn't been thicker or had less breakage or any of those things, but I still love this CLEAR Shampoo because of the thickness of the suds.

For years I've been a Pantene user but I'm switching!

Unlike other shampoos that suds up but tend to run if not washed away quickly, CLEAR is thick and doesn't run. I actually scrub my hair and then leave it up while I finish showering then rinse. And it just feels so good.

As I said, though, even with my newfound shampoo love, I can't speak to it's "special affects," because I haven't noticed any difference in my own hair.

My hair is clean and shampooing feels good - that's enough for me!

My unmanageable mane of hair currently falls to the middle of my back. It's very fine, tangles easily and tends to confound many shampoos. Given the amount of hair, I am used to having to use a lot of product just to work up a lather. I've occasionally used some higher end brands and given up simply because I'm pouring out too much at once trying to work up a lather. It's hardly worth the price if I'm use a quarter of the bottle at a time. Cheaper shampoos tend to fall into two categories, gloppy or watery enough to run out of my hand. I've tended to use them because of price, but it's a quick suds and wash with the objective to get my hair rinsed as quickly as possible.

This shampoo is neither gloppy nor too watery. I can pop up the spout and use just about a quarter sized amount of shampoo to lather up the entire mass of hair. It lathers quickly, with a pleasant texture and smell and rinses out without the feeling I've either dried my hair out or left a stick residue. My hair is noticeably more manageable, especially when I have to brush it out and detangle it (which is a chore). I'm able to get it combed and ready for my day in about half the time it takes with cheaper shampoos. While I don't like this shampoo quite as much as the Shea shampoo, it's a wonderful go-to for my color weary hair that doesn't cost my grocery budget to buy. As with all products, if you have sensitive skin, it's probably worthwhile to be cautious with anything not designed for sensitive skin. I haven't had any problems with it, and my skin appears to be less dried out than usual after showers--which is a plus.

^_^ Shanshad

This shampoo is very good for your hair.  I have a scalp problem, plus I color my hair and this is a great product.  I use it with the conditioner and it leaves my hair very silky in spite of washing it often.  It is a pink creamy texture and the scent is terrific because it is not overpowering just a nice soft clean smell.  You will love it!

I have used ths shampoo for a month or so. This bottle was the first i recieved from amazon but not the first i used. I'm very happy with it. It has a pleasant but not overpowering scent, lathers up quickly and rinses out easily. My hair when dry doesn't look weighed down the way it does with some other shampoos. It was shipped tightly wrapped in plastic and while there was a little leakage into the wrap it was completely contained and easily rinsed off from the bottle so it didn't concern me.

My husband and I tried this product along with the corresponding conditioner. His hair is dry, thinning, and brittle, very curly but not color treated. Mine is normal, slightly wavy, with good body, and salon colored.

He likes this product for the moisturizing effect. We have tried just about every product we can find but his hair continues to be fragile. This is the first product that he said actually makes a difference. His hair is softer and breaks less after only 2 weeks.

For my color treated hair, it's made no positive difference. I don't like the texture feel of the hair when wet, and my color has faded twice as fast as it does using John Frieda shampoo for red hair.

We'll probably keep buying this product for my husband's brittle hair, but I've stopped using it on mine.

I was surprised by how much I loved this shampoo. It is, after all, just shampoo. That said, the lather is very rich and the smell is fantastic. Has a hint of a berry smell. My hair always feels great after use. I am switching my brand!

This is my first time using this shampoo and I was very happy with it.  The product is smooth, has a wonderfully pleasant aroma --not too strong-- and lathers up well.  My hair felt soft and shiny, and after using nearly the entire bottle I haven't experienced any build-up or other strange after-effects.  I did not use it with the conditioner, so I don't know what their combined effect would be, but I would recommend the shampoo and will likely use it again.

I ordered both the Clear Scalp Shampoo and the Conditioner for Damage and Color Repair since I regularly color my dark hair and like to use products that help sustain the color. I typically buy sulfate-free since those seem to work best, and was a little bit surprised that this formula contained sulfates. However, I didn't notice any negative difference in my color after using it for a just few weeks.

The shampoo did seem to be a thorough cleanser,leaving my hair "squeaky clean" and once I added the conditioner it left my hair soft and silky as I stepped out of the shower. I found the scent clean and pleasant and it doesn't linger at all after rinsing.

Once blow-dried, it did seem that the shampoo might have been a bit of a stronger cleanser than I am used to since my hair was slightly fluffier than usual. It could also be that the conditioner was not as deep conditioning as I have found with other products made for color-treated or damaged hair. I should note that I have relatively "normal-dry" wavy hair and this might be a bit more ideal for those who have "oily-normal" hair.

I would recommend this combo to anyone looking for a super clean head of hair with body, but not to anyone who tends to have dry hair to begin with since it may be a bit too harsh. I also wonder about long term use on color treated hair with a product that contains sulfates, since I prefer those without. They performed pretty well, so I did give the shampoo/conditioner 4 stars, but it could have had 5 if it were sulfate-free.

For the shampoo: This smells really nice and my hair is shiny and soft. As for is it is helping me damaged scalp? I don't think anyone would really be able to tell. I trust the scientific formula the smart guys put in it that it will actually make my scalp healthier. I do really like the scent and how soft and feathery my hair is after using this repeatedly. I also got the conditioner with it and use them together.

If you were a child of the 80's you will feel a definite sense of deja vu with this product! The smell and feel of it reminded me instantly of PermaSoft. The next closest smell would be Pert Plus. It's the same manufacturer as Pert Plus so that makes sense.

This shampoo did a great job of removing hairstyling product buildup without stripping my hair, and I didn't have to shampoo twice to achieve that. I tested it on 3-day-old gross hair, and one wash removed all the buildup and gunk! I used it without a follow up conditioner and my hair was not frizzy, dry, or flyaway like it normally would be with what I consider a 'drugstore product'. It was very soft and had soft waves, no frizz.

I normally only use a few certain salon brands on my hair because I have it colored and I use a flatiron a lot (lots of damage potential there!); I would consider this brand of shampoo to be an acceptable substitute and not worry too much that it's stripping my color in the meantime.

I would buy this.

I was a bit skeptical about this item.  But the shampoo smells great and works well.  It puts a lot of hydration in my hair, especially at the ends, which always seem to be dry and splitting.  I haven't tried it with its corresponding conditioner, but I feel that would even be better and I am happy with using only the shampoo then my usual conditioner.

The shampoo is opaque, with a slightly pinkish color. It is very smooth and comes out of the bottle easily. Note the bottle opens at the top, whereas that of the conditioner opens at the bottom. Also the bottle is skinny, so it looks to hold more than its 12.9 fluid ounces or 381 milliliters. It did not irritate my scalp and was smooth to apply. If you have really filthy, greasy hair then Dawn Ultra Dishwashing Liquid, Original Scent, Blue, 24 Ounce (Pack of 2) would provide a stronger degreasing effect, but it could make the hair dry. So the shampoo has to be rubbed in for a while to remove dirt well. Then the hair has to be rinsed to remove the bubbles and other shampoo ingredients.

I tried it twice - the first time I did not use conditioner. The second time, after I used the shampoo I used CLEAR SCALP & HAIR BEAUTY Volumizing Root Boost Nourishing Conditioner, 12.7 Fluid Ounce. The shampoo was so creamy that I thought it might be possible to avoid using conditioner - the results were OK - my hair was not frizzy. However, with the conditioner it became quite shiny and silky.

I am not commenting on the toxicity or lack of toxicity of the ingredients. I am giving an ingredient list so readers can find what is in the product. The ingredients in common with CLEAR SCALP & HAIR BEAUTY Volumizing Root Boost Nourishing Conditioner, 12.7 Fluid Ounce are:

Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract
Ascorbic Acid
Dimethiconol
DMDM Hydantoin
Fragrance
Glycerin
Glycine Soja (Soybean) Oil
Helianthus Annus (Sunflower) Seed Oil
Hydrogenated Coconut Oil
Lysine HCI
Methychloroisothiaszolinone
Methylisothiaszolinone
Niacinamide
Panthenol
Prunus Amygdalus Dulcis (Sweet Almond) Oil
Red 33 (CL 17200)
Sodium Chloride
TEA-dodecylbenzenesulfonate
Tocopheryl Acetate
Water
Zinc Pyrithione
Zinc Sulphate

The ingredients in the shampoo and not in the conditioner are:
Bismuth Oxychloride (Cl 77163)
Carbomer
Citric Acid
Cocomidopropyl Betaine
Dimethicone
Guar Hydroxypeopyltrimonium Chloride
Mica (Cl 77019)
Poloxamer 407
Sodium Isethionate
Sodium Laureth Sulfate
Sodium Lauroyl Isethionate
Stearic Acid
Tallow Acid
Titanium Dioxide (CL 77891)
Xanthan Gum

Ingredients in the conditioner and not in the shampoo are:
Behentrimonium Chloride
Cetearyl Alcohol - emulsifier, foaming agent
Cyclopentasiloxane - silicone to stop hair breaking
Dimethylamine
Dipropylene Glycol
Lactic Acid
PEG-150 Distearate
Stearamidopropyl

I may have missed some ingredients in common as some ingredients have multiple names and shampoo labeling tends to be inconsistent.

As you can see there are multiple chemicals. The shampoo claims it has 10 vitamins and nutrients.

I prefer shampoos with simpler ingredient lists. Despite various nut and seed oils, this is really a chemical-based shampoo. However, the shampoo works well and provides a high quality wash. It does what it claims to do - repairs damage. With 4 coloring agents at least (that make the shampoo the same hue as the bottle), I assume it "repairs color" - whatever that means!

I wish the ingredients weren't hidden under the label - as it was they came off with the label and I had to scan them from behind then reflect them in Adobe Photoshop CS4 - Old Version to read them.

I have naturally light colored hair...aka grey/white...lol but wanted to
try this to see if it would help soften it a bit more cause lets face it,
grey hair has a mind of its own! I liked this, my hair felt very clean
and a nice scent. I also liked the shape of the bottle, most people could
care less about that, I have small and arthritic hands, so appreciate a
bottle I can grip and hold without dropping it. It was also used by my
husband, well...he says its shampoo...lol I liked this and also tried
the matching conditioner and reviewed that product too.

I live in a dry climate with hard water and colored hair and that equals dry skin and dry hair. I'm skeptical about hair product claims because I have found that products vary only slightly - if at all - from the cheapest products to the most expensive. But Clear Scalp and Hair is distinctly different. After about a week of use I actually could tell that my scalp was less dry - I didn't have flakes and it didn't feel tight after a hot shower. My hair is prone to oiliness, and I didn't experience excessive oiliness with this product, nor did it weigh my hair down. It also smells great, which is a bonus.

Overall, I'd say I have found my new shampoo - it works great.

This shampoo foams up very well and doesn't fade your color.  Leaves your hair soft and shiny and rinses out well leaving no residue.  All in all, just what a shampoo for color-treated hair should be.

After watching commercials I wanted to give this a try and I was so happy I did. Best shampoo/conditioner I have used In my life and i have really damaged color highlited hair!!!! This actually makes your hair silky soft and the smell lasts in your hair the whole day. The conditioner works better than my neutrogena deep conditioner by far

I have been having my hair highlighted for years, so I am always looking for products that care-take long-colored hair. At the same time, I have oily hair and need to wash it daily. This product has been surprisingly good.

The shampoo itself has a nice consistency and a pleasant fragrance that, in my opinion, does not overpower. It lathers well, and my scalp has had no issues with either dryness or oiliness. In addition, my color has looked better - something that friends/colleagues have remarked on since I began using this.

I like to switch off my shampoos, and I could definitely see keeping this in the rotation.

I have been using the CLEAR Damage & Color Repair shampoo with the CLEAR SCALP & HAIR BEAUTY Damage & Color Repair Nourishing Conditioner, 12.7 Fluid Ounce for two weeks now. While I don't know if my hair is stronger, I can definitely see a difference in the shine. Also, my color hasn't visibly faded while using it. But what I love most about this shampoo is the scent. I can't really pin it down--it's maybe slightly fruity?--but it reminds me of the Matrix Biolage shampoo I used to buy simply because I loved the scent. Since this is a fraction of the Biolage price, I think I'll stick with CLEAR!

First of all I want to say that I also had a problem with my shampoo bottle breaking and getting everywhere during shipping. In my case, it was UPS's fault since the package actually had foot prints on it and looked beat up. Amazon was quick to reship me a new bottle that arrived fine. If you have this issue, Amazon is willing to fix it for you.

On to the shampoo..I normally alternate between Herbal Essences, Pantene Pro-V and Aussie. I have straight, thick, long, highlighted hair. I was a little disappointed to see that this shampoo has Sodium Laureth Sulfate in it. Sodium Laureth Sulfate is known for being bad for colored hair, so I am not sure why it is in this "Color Repair" shampoo.

The shampoo itself is thick and creamy and has a slightly pink color. It has a really nice almost floral scent. It lathers well and you don't have to use a ton of it. Honestly, it feels like Pantene Pro-V. It leaves your hair feeling clean, soft and healthy. However, I don't think it does anything to repair your color. The Sodium Laureth Sulfate may even harm it. My hair is not damaged, so I can not attest to that part of the shampoo claim.

Overall, I do like the shampoo and will buy it in the future, but only if it is on sale.

I'm always careful about products for my color treated "naturally blonde" hair. This shampoo is thick and creamy, goes on smoothly, has a fresh and very pleasant scent and does a very nice job. My hair is silky and smooth after use, and I've noticed it doesn't get so flyaway in humid weather. This goes great with the matching conditioner, of course. Highly recommend.

I tend to have a flaky and dry scalp. I occasionally use dandruff shampoos and they help somewhat. When I saw this new shampoo, I thought I'd give it a go. I'd prefer to use a "regular" shampoo than a special one so it seemed worth a try.

The CLEAR shampoo is very thick. It lathers up quite nicely and stays on your head rather than dripping down. It seemed thicker than any other shampoo I tried -- more like a conditioner than a shampoo. After using it for a week or so, I'd have to say that my scalp felt less itchy and dry. I didn't notice any significant other changes -- my hair wasn't shinier or easier to manage but I did think it help clear up my scalp issues somewhat.

The smell is subtle and not too strong.

I would use this shampoo again.

I've been using this shampoo exclusively for a couple of weeks and will continue using it. The scent is difficult to pin down: it's a light scent and reminds me of the smell of shampoo at my hairdresser's but it doesn't really smell like anything (mint, fruit, spice). It has pleasant lather and leaves my hair manageable. I'm not sure that using this will keep my color from fading more rapidly than it does, but it's not a bad shampoo.

I have fairly thick wavy hair and live in a humid climate--so I appreciate the fact that my hair does not frizz much with this product.

The only problem I had was with the delivery of the shampoo. Although it was wrapped in plastic, the cap was not secured and about 1/3 of the bottle emptied into the shipping envelope. I don't think I'd ever order shampoo in the mail after that experience.

I find it odd that a color safe shampoo would contain sulfates. Beware if you are trying to avoid them, especially if you have any kind of keratin treatment.

The shampoo lathers well, and smells nice. I didn't see a noticable difference in my scalp being less dry, though. It is an okay product, but I don't see myself using it again.

I have wavy hair which I wear blow dried and flat ironed. It has a tendency to be dry, and it is very prone to frizziness.
I have tried a lot of products (of various costs) to try to make my hair shiny, straight, and non-frizzy.
I received this shampoo, and the accompanying conditioner a couple of weeks ago, and have been using them exclusively, without using any additional products.
The shampoo is packaged in a very usable bottle, it is easy to get the shampoo out, even with hands that are wet and slippery.
The shampoo is very sudsy, and has almost no odor. Even though there are lots of suds, they rinse out very easily. My hair feels clean and soft after shampooing.
I have not used the shampoo without the conditioner, so the comments are for both products used together.
After towel drying my hair, it is relatively easy to comb through, although there are some small tangles. After blow drying my hair is really soft and nice, and the flat iron straightens it very well.
I have noticed, though, that my hair has a tendency to be somewhat fly-away with this product, so I will try to use a leave-in product as well.
Since I live in Florida, humidity is a big problem, and I do not find this product to help with frizziness.
All in all I really like this shampoo, and I would give it 5 stars if I lived in a less humid area.

i gave this to the wife for her to use.  after a couple of applications she said that it did help her hair and was repairing the split ends.  she said wouldn't know about the color repair since her hair is turning silver anyway.  looking at her hair it seemed to me that it seemed fluffier and the color was a little bit bolder-but hey what does a man know.

I am a big fan of Suave and since this product is made by the same company, I jumped at the chance to try something new from them. I have to say my review may be tainted by the way the product came to me. First, when the package arrived, it was leaking. The bottle was inside a plastic bag which must have been made to seal in any leakage. I don't know if it was broken or the button on top somehow got pushed, but half of the bottle of shampoo was out. Once I cut off the wrapping and threw away the spoils, the bottle seemed okay. I put it in my shower, eager to try it the next morning.
The shampoo itself is okay. It smells and feels like the "color seal" shampoo you get in a hair-dye box for after rinsing. I'm not found of that sort of smell everyday, but it's not unpleasant. After using the shampoo for a couple of days, my hair felt limp and oily compared to using Suave shampoo and conditioner (I like to use Mango Mandarin, Citrus Smoothie, or Apple). For someone who's hair is usually light, healthy, and shiny, I did not like the effect this shampoo gave to my hair. For someone who tends to have dry scalp, it might help you. I stopped using it after a week.
After a few uses, the bottle started leaking from the (almost) invisible seam holding the lid on. I don't know if I got a messed up bottle or if this is how they all are. I would not buy this again.

I am a die hard salon product user, usually Aveda Color Conserve Shampoo, 8.5-Ounce Bottle or Bumble and Bumble Gentle Shampoo, 8-Ounce Bottle as I color my hair every 6 weeks at the salon. So a product really has to be good to get my approval. Clear falls short.

It will clean your hair, but the quality here is very much more grocery store - you get what you pay for. Its claims to give one a healthier scalp are unfounded, in my opinion, as there was no decrease in scalp dryness over weeks of use. For a truly healthy scalp, try Nioxin Cleanser, System 2 (Fine/Noticeably Thinning ), 33.8 Ounce and pair it with Nioxin Scalp Therapy, System 3 (Fine/Treated/Normal to Thin-Looking), 33.8 Ounce.

The scent of Clear lingers all day, but it does this by being overpowering. Hair is not nourished, feeling dry and fly away after use.

I gave my wife the new "CLEAR Scalp and Hair Therapy shampoo and conditioner for damage and color repair" for her birthday. She is picky about her hair products and has trained me to purchase only those for color treated hair, though she rarely admits to having color added. I've learned my lesson, about her pickiness, when buying shampoo and conditioner, but I dared to try something new.

Whew! Did I ever score with CLEAR! She told me "the bottle shapes are so cute, and the open/close mechanism was very secure," something she doesn't always find on her regular brands. She also said she doesn't need to use as big a portion to clean as she has before, making it very economical. She said the suds felt thick, smooth, and it had a nice mild scent.

After just a couple days of use, and especially after a full week of daily use, she thought her hair was indeed shinier thatn before, had much better texture, and seemed smooth, manageable, and extremely soft. Usually in the humidity of warm weather she has the "frizzies." When the CLEAR runs out, she asked me to get her more. Boy, do I now have little gifts for future occasions--the jackpot of suprise gift-giving!

This shampoo has a nice light fragrance and lathers quickly and efficiently (even in pretty hard water). My hair is color-treated and on the dry and thick side. The first time I used this product, my hair felt more dry, but after a few shampoos, I find that it leaves my hair feeling comparatively clean and soft. It is definitely best applied with the companion conditioner (clear scalp and hair beauty damage and color repair nourishing conditioner). A good choice for the price.

I have very fine, long and thin hair that I color to hide the gray.  I also live in the northern part of the country and during the colder months my hair is SO dry it is like straw.  I tried the Clear Scalp conditioner, and really liked it, so I broke down to try the Clear Scalp shampoo.  I got this one because my hair is colored and so dry that I would call it a bit damaged.  I tried this shampoo with the conditioner and didn't need to add any leave in conditioner after my shower - this stuff just really cleaned my hair and conditioned it so well that I just blow dried it and was good to go.  I am very happy with this product, and I love the smell.  I would recommend this and buy it again.

I've been using both the shampoo and conditioner for a few days now. It has a nice long lasting fragrance. My hair feels clean and soft. I reitterate SOFT. I go the salon on a regular basis to have my hair colored. I use shampoo/conditioner for color treated hair and some have left my hair feeling dry. Not the case with Clear Scalp & Hair Beauty. It really left my hair feeling soft through out the day.

Another bonus: for people like me, who need eye glasses to read and have a hard time deciphering which bottle is the shampoo and which is the conditioner, the shape of both bottles is not only very helpful but is also very clever. Both bottles have a flat spot and you push down for the spot to open and dispense shampoo or conditioner. The shampoo sits up right with the spot on the top and the conditioner sits with the spot on the bottom. No problem with trying to figure out which bottle is the shampoo or conditioner.

I liked this product and will be purchasing more.

For the last 12 years I have colored my hair religiously every 3 months. For the last 11 years I spent countless dollars on salon products and finally decided that their has to be other products that work as well if not better. I am surprised I liked this shampoo as much as I did because I have been using sulfate free however I did assume that since this was "Clear" it was also sulfate free however it is the second ingredient on the list. Lathers well, great scent, and leaves my hair soft and silky. Color is very vibrant however I will alternate after this bottle finishes back to my sulfate free and then back to this just to change it up.

I actually bought this shampoo at the supermarket.  The reason I give it 3 stars is the bottle lid design.  It is WAY too easy for the top to open in a bag, box or whatever.  The checkout person bagged this shampoo by itself which was a godsend because the top tipped open and half the contents were in the bag.  I would expect many more negative comments like this one unless they change their lid design or tape off the top so it can't tip to the open position.  I liked the scent of the shampoo (on the strong side) and thought it cleaned well, left my hair full bodied and my scalp moisturized.  I agree with another poster about the SLS.  I primarily use WEN or Loreal Creme (LOVE IT) and my bleached hair looks wonderful after being severely damaged due to bleaching and nutritional problems.  Clear did not give me the luminosity and shine or define my color hair the way the creme poo does.  I will only use whats left on occassion when I want a fluffier style.

I have thick shoulder-length hair that every 3 - 4 months my salonist either colors or highlights (and chops away some of the thickness so I don't look like a wooly mammoth). For this reason, I switched from using my usual brand, Fructis Sleek and Shine fortifying Shampoo By Garnier for Unisex Shampoo, 13 Ounce, to this brand.

PLEASE NOTE: This was used in conjunction with CLEAR SCALP & HAIR BEAUTY Damage & Color Repair Nourishing Conditioner, 12.7 Fluid Ounce.

I rather liked the packaging. It is a little similar to the Clear Conditioner, but fortunately, I have sharp eyes. The shampoo itself had a nice, light pleasant smell, and a good consistency (neither too thick, nor too thin and watery).

I started out with about a palm-sized amount of shampoo--what normally would have been just enough with my regular brand. I quickly found out that this was too much for the Clear shampoo. It lathers quite nicely and also rinses out quite easily.

But the end results were what stunned me. My hair was delightfully soft and smooth! After flat-ironing my hair, my hair was sleek and flat in a way that I could only rarely get from my usual hair products. But the best part was when a coworker approached me and asked if I had recently gone in to have my hair cut and colored. I told him, no, my last appointment was a month ago!

I am now a convert; I'm saying goodbye to Garnier Fructus, and hello to Clear and better hair!

Brought to you by:
*C.S. Light*

I can't say enough good things about the Clear Scalp & Hair line. The product delivers exactly what it claims to do...beautiful, clean hair. The shampoo is creamy and silky with a very rich lather. It rinses well without a filmy residue left behind. The scent is light and pleasing and not overpowering like some leading shampoos on the market. The only negative thing I can say about this product is that I wish it came in a bigger size! Definitely worth the money!

For a product that is supposed to nourish damaged and colored hair, I was surprised that the second ingredient is sodium laurel sulfate, a harsh, cheap ingredient to help foaming/lather. I've started buying soaps and shampoos without sodium laurel sulfate.

I also found the fragrance too strong.

When it arrived, it was wrapped in plastic, in a padded envelope. The envelop had been squeezed so some of the shampoo squished out. I could smell the shampoo through the envelop.

My hair is soft and clean. My scalp is clean.

It's OK but I don't think I'd get it again.

AUGUST 21, 2012 UPDATE:
I've been using a Conditioning - Shampoo (like Wen) for a couple of weeks and find Clear Scalp and Hair is a MUST - at least once a week. The conditioning shampoos clean the hair but not the scalp. Clear SCALP and Hair is extremely helpful - actually necessary - to clean "debris" aka dandruff so I can enjoy a conditioning shampoo. : )

I have color-treated (all-over blonde highlights) and very fine hair... but a lot of it! I originally tried the volumizing shampoo and condition by Clear but I needed more moisture. This one is great!

Even with the first washing my hair was more manageable, styled better, and was so shiney and bright! One of the guys I work with said it looked blonder and asked if I just got it done!

I know it has sulfate but my hair looks great anyway!

I love this shampoo!!
my hair is silky and smells wonderful and the dirt
is gone! just one washing did it.
i color my hair and the color was brighter not dull and there
was no color rinsed out while washing.

2 definate thumbs up!!

These were a big family hit.
They have a bigger fruit taste
than non-organic.

I found them to be very sweet.
Makes a great snack or even dessert!

The plain Apple Cinnamon was the first ones that I tried.  After reading some of the reviews, I went out and bought the frosted Apple along with the Frosted Strawberry.  Once again I agree with previous posters stating that the frosted is better than the plain. For me it is almost a tie between the Apple Cinnamon and the Strawberry.  The Strawberry might be slightly better.  I'd like to try the other flavors, and I don't think I'll be disappointed.

Delicious as breakfast or a snack.
I bought these as an alternative to
non-organic cereal & milk for breakfast.

They were a big hit & I do not have to keep
non-organic milk on hand. I have not been
able to find organic powdered milk they will
drink.

I love that these are vegetarian.  Other toaster pastries contain gelatin, which I try to stay away from.  These make a great snack.  They are very sweet.  I cannot eat just one which is probably bad.  I think I am going to try the unfrosted variety to see if they are less sweet.
Toast it for 1 min. perfect breakfast. I wish it was a little less sweet though.
Better than the non-frosted blueberry, but I'm just not a fan.

Yes they are organic and no preservatives or high fructose crapola, but this product uses white flour. That means no hull on the wheat and no fiber... as was intended by nature. Also it has a lot of sugar and thus high calories.
They taste very good, like a dessert. It is easy to eat two at a time but with so much white flour and sugar they can add weight to you and raise blood sugar levels.
I recommend only eating on occasion and as a small treat or dessert in order to curb a sweet tooth. It is not a good choice for a breakfast item.

I saw this product in a local health foods store and had to buy it. I used to like "Pop Tarts" a long time ago, but have not been able to eat them because of all the artificial colors and flavors they contain. This organic version tastes great! And the pomegranate flavor is the best, in my opinion, compaired to the other flavors. However, the reason for me to give it two stars is that it has a ton of sugar! About 32 grams of sugar, if I recall correctly. Without a doubt, sugar is the worst part of any product, and I was hoping that an organic `pop tart' would be made with less sugar and more natural sugar-free sweeteners like Xylitol. I urge people to not eat such products that have so much sugar in them, because eating them will tax your pancreas and make you overweight. Please look for a more salubrious breakfast item.

I tried these, even though I haven't had a toaster "pastry" since I was a kid (and didn't much care for them then, either).  For what they are, I suppose they are good, especially considering the healthy/organic angle.  However, honestly, I wouldn't bother purchasing these again.  They are a hard, piecrust-like wrap encasing a very thin smear of jam, with another very thin smear of "frosting" on the outside.  The flavor honestly is pretty much "sweet cardboard".  Just not really worth eating, in my opinion.  A piece of toast with jam is more appealing.

Companies should be ashamed of themselves. These are far from Whole Grain...The 1st ingredient is Organic Wheat Flour...not whole grain! That is the 5th item listed and only provides 1 gram of fiber...Many companies are on the band wagon portraying their products as whole grain goodness and this is because the FDA has not come up with guide lines for whole grains...!

Organic Wheat Flour, Organic Evaporated Cane Juice Invert, Organic Evaporated Cane Juice, Organic Palm Oil, Organic Whole Wheat Flour
I was annoyed that I could not return these(did not know that when I bought them)they are very sweet & have 5 grams of fat each which is not very healthy in my opinion.

I stopped eating pop-tarts because of all the junk that was in them (hydrogenated oils, artificial colors, etc).

I tried these and - wow! They are actually better tasting than pop-tarts. They still have the rich buttery crust, but their filling is actual fruit, and tastes incredible.

These look exactly the same as pop-tarts, right down to the foil wrapper and little grooves on the back of the pastry. They have organic ingredients though, and no hydrogenated oils, white flour, or artificial colors.

This doesn't make them completely "healthy" (these are still over 1/3 sugar by weight), but for an occasional snack they are awesome.

The grocery store is saturated with products that are high in sugar and fat and frankly I've become weary reading labels. I've started to buy more and more organic products and find that many of them meet or exceed my expectations for flavor and quality.

Nature's Path Organic Blueberry Toaster Pastries are made organic wheat flour and they are absolutely delicious. They heat up fast in the toaster for breakfast with a cup of tea and are convenient for a snack. I'd go as far as to say these are better than cookies.

~The Rebecca Review

All of the Nature's Path organic toaster pastries are delicious, and actually good for you, to the extent that a carb filled toaster pastry can be. The frosting amount is just right, not too little, and not too overpowering.

As for flavor preference, here's where I stand:

strawberry > apple cinnamon > blueberry

These are our new favorite breakfast food.  FANTASTIC!!!!  We love them, and that's even after we're on our second set of 12 boxes.  The strawberry flavoring tastes real, not fake like regular pop tarts.  Overall, the taste is sweet but not overly so.  This flavor is better than the apple cinnamon, which we have also tried.  Definitely one of our best Amazon purchases ever.

First and foremost, these toaster pastries taste great! You get light, crusty pastry and impressive chocolate flavor. So if you're worried about whether or not toaster pastries that are billed as organic and healthy can measure up favorably to the market leader, I suggest you try them - I think you'll be pleasantly surprised.

It would definitely be a stretch to call these toaster pastries health food, despite the organic, low sodium, zero trans fat and vegetarian claims. But the saturated fat percentage is only 15% of the USRDA 2,000 calorie reference diet, which is relatively low for a toaster pastry. The percent of total calories that come from fat is also relatively low. But you can do that much diet damage with just one or two of some kinds of cookies, and the portion size of these pastries - the nutrition information provided assumes that you're eating an entire pastry - is far more satisfying than a cookie or two. Many people might find just half a pastry to be satisfying. So if you're looking for something sweet to eat, I'd call this a good choice.

Kosher certification is provided by COR (Kashrus Council of Canada, based in Toronto, Ontario), and the product is dairy.

I have tried all of the frosted flavors and by far, strawberry is the best.It has a strong strawberry flavor with a light frosting that has the perfect sweetness. And this is coming from a non-Pop Tart fan. My order of flavor preference is strawberry, maple sugar cinnamon, cherry/pomegranate, blueberry, apple cinnamon, and surprisingly last is chocolate which I thought would be my favorite.

These toaster pastries are very very good.These are filled with real strawberries and not that sugary sweet junk found in poptarts.You can feel good about letting your family have these for breakfast or a snack..

I never thought I would see the day!!!! This is an amazing product. Another excellent healthy junk food replacement, and they taste wonderful. To me the traditional Pop Tart taste like cardboard, these you can actually taste flavor. HIGHLY RECCOMMEND.

These Frosted Wildberry Acai Toaster Pastries are very tasty. They have a strong berry flavor and a delicate crust that is slightly cruncy.

The pinky-purple frosting is a hit with the kids. They call them "Purple Flurp" tarts. (From Jimmy Neutron on Nikelodeon) And they like them!

Real fruit, whole grains, no high fructose corn syrup and reasonably priced. Guilt free treats for my kids (mom and dad too).

I've tried the Apple, Strawberry, and now the Cherry Pomegranate.  All of them are pretty good. The Cherry Pomegranate doesn't taste that much different than the strawberry.  It might have more of a berry flavor to it.  Compared to a pop tart they're not as flavorful, but they're a step in the healthy direction.  They've got enough sweet to get the job done. Make sure whichever one you buy, that you get the frosted and not the plain.  The plain is too dull without the frosting complimenting it. The only fruit flavor left for me to try now is the blueberry.

Although my kids prefer Pop Tarts, this is a healthy alternative. Believe it or not, the Apple without the frosting is pretty decent. There is cinnamon on the top of it which adds a bit of spice...I don't really like too much frosting on mine. The cherry pomengrante is the most preferred in my home. They don't last as long as opposed to the blueberry...Strawberry is delicious too. They travel pretty well too. Don't crumble too much...

All of the Nature's Path organic toaster pastries are delicious, and actually good for you, to the extent that a carb filled toaster pastry can be. The frosting amount is just right, not too little, and not too overpowering.

As for flavor preference, here's where I stand:

strawberry > apple cinnamon > blueberry

(hence 4 stars for this flavor, rather than 5)

These pastries are one of the most delicious I have ever eaten! The strawberry taste is incredible and the final appearance is excellent. It is appropriate for guests and private parties. The amount is quite a lot and you may indulge for a long time especially because it is organic and healthy. I am very, very pleased with this purchase.

The kids love 'em and what could be better than that?  I bought one box at the local grocery and glad to see they are available here.  We tried the strawberry, frosted, and like other reviewers I agree:  not too sweet, right amount of frosting.  Can't wait to try the next flavor.

I was never a pop tart fan, but on a lark and due to the coupon, I tried these. I was pleasantly surprised at how good they tasted. I would prefer more filling as you can barely taste it. The frosting is very light and adds a perfect sweetness. One package w/ coffee is a perfect quick breakfast. Since AMZ is now out of stock for this flavor, I ordered the apple frosted ones.I think the unfrosted might be too flavorless for me.

I went out and bought the frosted Strawberry. I must say I really like them. The first time I tried this product was in the Apple Cinnamon flavor that was not frosted. Like some of the other posters have stated, go for the frosted. The plain ones are ok, but the frosted ones hits the spot.

For me it is hard to decide which is better, the Strawberry or the Apple Cinnamon. I haven't tried the Blueberry yet, but I'm tempted to see how it tastes.
These are very good breakfast and snacks!  The only downside is they are pretty hard just cold.  So pop them in the toaster and makes a world of differance!

Nature's Path Organic Toaster Pastries,Frosted Strawberry are so good.I've been buying them for years.I'd tell anyone to buy and eat these.
Heated up with a glass of milk....HEAVEN.
I have always been pretty picky about my poptarts, so I wasn't sure if these were going to taste like cardboard or not when I first got them.  They are great poptarts.  My kids love them.

Yes, these Toaster Pastries from Nature's Path are the only thing my 3-year-old will eat for her breakfast.  Thanksfully, they are fairly healthy.  Now her 2 older brothers are making it a staple for their breakfast also.  They are very tasty and toast well in the toaster.  The frosted strawberry and blueberry ones are equally as good - just depends on your taste preference.  We have not tried any of the UNfrosted ones though!
My kids loved these chocolate toaster pastries on the mornings we were running late and needed to grab something quick on the way out the door.

Two out of my three boys love these toaster pastries.  They are pretty healthy for them and are a great snack to throw in my bag when we are on the go.  My only suggestion would be to wrap them individually, because I only let them have one at a time, which is plenty.  Or, to eliminate unnecessary packaging, pack them without the individual wrappers in the box.

The grocery store is saturated with products that are high in sugar and fat and frankly I've become weary reading labels. I've started to buy more and more organic products and find that many of them meet or exceed my expectations for flavor and quality.

Nature's Path Organic Apple Cinnamon Toaster Pastries do taste "slightly" healthy, but they remind me of some nutmeg cookies I make that are also made with whole-wheat flour.

Ingredients: Organic apple cinnamon filling (organic evaporated cane juice, organic apple juice concentrate, water, organic evaporated apples, vegetable glycerin, organic apple powder, organic corn startch, organic cinnamon, locust bean gum), organic whole-wheat flour, organic white flour, water, organic evaporated cane juice, organic palm oil, powdered organic eveaporated cane juice, organic invert syrup, salt, leavening, natural flavor, agar, tocopherols (for freshness).

Unfortunately these do contain palm oil, although I don't seem to be as allergic to organic palm oil. Makes me wonder what I'm really allergic to, as in what is in the additional element in the non-organic Palm Kernel Oil. Could it simply be that this is the non-hydrogenated version. Could be.

Each pastry is 190 Calories

40 Calories from Fat

They heat up fast in the toaster and are convenient for a snack.

~The Rebecca Review

These are the very best of any organic or non-organic toaster pastry we have ever tried.  Cherry Pomegran is the favorite flavor in our house.  It has a real fruit taste and a real pastry taste, not like regular brand & store brands that have always left me with indigestion and a lingering unpleasant taste.  Plus they have healthier ingredients than regular brands so I can feel good about giving these one or two times a week for really quick breakfasts or on the go breakfast when necessary.  We have embraced organic foods since the mid 1990's and these are among the best.  Amazon offers a better deal  than the ones we got at retail store.  By the way, strawberry frosted is our family's second favorite flavor.  Recommend trying them.  Five stars for sure.

i have four kids and we all love these. i never bought pop tarts for them until i saw these. i bought them initially at earthfare but it is much cheaper to get them here. we have also tried the brown sugar cinnamon but these are the best. :)

Every one of my children love these toaster pastries...which is hard to accomplish in this house!  I had originally purchased them from our local health food store($3.89/box) because my pickiest eater begged for them.  Obviously, I'm not going to continuously pay that much for a box of 6 toaster pastries.  So, I went on the hunt for the best price.  I purchased these through Subscribe & Save on Amazon and I get them for $2.29/box with free shipping.  That means I don't even have to go TO the store.  What a deal!  We're going to try the Wildberry Acai next...I'll let you know what we think of those!

I bought this item to eat healthier and was very surprised at the fantastic taste.  My grandson loves them.  My friends even asked me to order more boxes and they are junk food nuts but didn't care that these are a healthy alternative.  They love them too!

One of the best, if not the best, Toaster Pastries on the market.  This flavor, Frosted Cherry Pomegranate, is excellent.  I haven't tasted better.  It is good cold or hot and as a snack, it is good  anytime.  Great for the kids.  The price is right. Its organic so no nasty surprises in the ingredients.

These are a great alternative to PopTarts. I've only tried the strawberry. Crust, icing, filling - all are delicious. My only change would be to make the filling thicker. The outer edges of the crust can be a little dry without a bit of the filling to go with it so I find myself breaking off the outside edges to get to the yummy middle. Maybe I'm just picky. But otherwise, I love them!
If you're going to go for the Apple, I'd recommend the frosted.  Sure it's more sugar, but it's also a lot more flavor.

Okay, in the grand scheme of things, if you're closely watching your calorie intake... these aren't for you. Yes, they are organic! LOVE that they are organic! But they have similar stats to their non-organic counterpart (one of these toaster pastries has 210 calories and 5g fat while the other non-organic brand's toaster pastries average the same - 210 calories and 5g fat). However, it's nice to see that the first ingredient in Nature's Path Frosted Raspberry toaster pastries is Organic Wheat Flour, while the other brand's first ingredient is enriched flour). At any rate, I picked up two different flavors of Nature's Path toaster pastries from my local Whole Foods and I haven't been able to stop eating them since. I bought the Wildberry Acai on Amazon without having tried them first, since I had yet to be disappointed by a flavor of theirs to date. While they are not my favorite flavor (the iced Raspberry and Frosted Brown Sugar Maple Cinnamon are beyond amazing), they definitely leave my tastebuds satisfied. I wouldn't say these are guilt-free, but I do feel less guilty knowing that they are organic!
We love Pop Tarts (the name brand ones) but wanted to get away from all the chemicals, food dyes, and especially HFCS that those are loaded with. These are a great substitute!

Making the change from a typical American diet to a healthier organic and more whole-grain centered diet is no mean feat with my 6-year-old. I have to work hard to find products that she really likes as, with most children her age, she is hooked on the artificial, high fructose-laden junk that is aggressively marketed to kids. I refuse to buy anything with high fructose corn syrup in it so, needless to say, Pop-Tarts are not known in my house. When I saw these at Whole Foods, I thought we'd give them a try.

Now, a big caveat here: this review is not meant to endorse this as a healthy breakfast. Organic or no, it is still a treat. That said, it is something I will allow my daughter once a week, and it is something that she really enjoys. I'm a former chocolate Pop-Tart addict and I can honestly say that I like these even better. The more I train my palate, the more I realize that all those foods that are chock full of artificial ingredients are actually quite disgusting. These pastries are sweet, but not cloying so, and the chocolate in them actually tastes like chocolate. What a concept.

I also want to note that purchasing them through subscribe and save is a considerable savings over buying them in the grocery store. When all is said and done, I'll have paid about a dollar a box less by ordering these through Amazon rather than buying them at Whole Foods. I not only like to eat healthier, I also like to trim the fat from my wallet.

My inlaws gave my kids the dreaded cardboard "pop-tarts", and well it has been difficult to find a natural, kosher replacement. Well folks here it is, my kids eat them all the time, they make a perfect snack that is not junk. I wish more variety packages were available. I absolutely reccomend this product in all flavors.
these are the BEST! toast light to medium & even the crust is fantastic. Real good with coffee. I'm sad when these are not in my pantry
My wife & mom really like these.  They are really good & replace the breakfast rush meal

The whole family loves these.  I seem to grab them on my way out the door because I didn't have time for a "real" breakfast.  I don't feel bad becuase they're not full of additives and preservatives, and they are organic and yummy!

After trying these at TJ's, i realized how awful pop-tarts tasted. These are much thicker and heartier, and they taste better! The membership warehouse store even has them for 8 bucks for 3 packs of 12, blueberry and strawberry. So cheap!

I hate Pop-Tarts, but I LOVE Nature's Path Organic Frosted Cherry Pomegranite Toaster Pastries! The reasons are obvious, Pop-Tarts taste like Brand-X aftificial jelly slathered on cardboard. The taste is bad and the texture is even worse.

But, one bite of Nature's Path Organic Frosted Cherry Pomegranite Toaster Pasteries and you are in Heaven. The pomegranite has just enough tartness to wake up your taste buds in the morning, and the breading is light and flaky. Add a mug of coffee and you have the perfect on the go breakfast to hold you for quite some time.

These things are YUM!

My daughter is allergic to every artificial food coloring.  This makes it difficult to find tasty treats for her sometimes.  When all the other kids are eating their Poptarts now she can have hers too!  These are really good.  The filling is flavorful and the outside not too dry.  They are pretty too, so she doesn't feel left out when the others are eating their dye-laden bad for them food. I find it hard to keep myself out of the box....
Nature's Path Organic Toaster Pastries, Apple Cinnamon are so good.I've been buying them for years.I'd tell anyone to buy and eat these.
Nature's Path Organic Toaster Pastries, Blueberry Frosted are so good.I've been buying them for years.I'd tell anyone to buy and eat these.

Even my husband has become a big fan of poptarts. My kids mention that the unfrosted ones can be a little dry, and that the apple-cinnamon is the best flavor, with blueberry a close second. Also tasty right out of the package for an on-the-go snack.
a little dry, but given that they're pretty healthy (all things considered), i'm willing to forgive...

These are very tasty indeed.  The flavors taste natural and fresh, better than I expected, and the texture is very good.  My young son has a real sweet tooth and these are a great treat for him. In fact my whole family enjoys them.  My husband about died when he saw I ordered a case of "Pop Tarts", but he was pleasantly surprised by the taste and the more healthful ingredients.  I will definitely keep these on my shopping list, and recommend them to anyone, especially families with children who want a quick and tasty snack that's a little more "fun" than a piece of toast and more wholesome than a donut or (most) cookies.

All of the Nature's Path organic toaster pastries are delicious, and actually good for you, to the extent that a carb filled toaster pastry can be. The frosting amount is just right, not too little, and not too overpowering.

As for flavor preference, here's where I stand:

strawberry > apple cinnamon > blueberry

(hence 4 stars for this flavor, rather than 5)

It is very hard to find organic products where I live.  I had bought a box when I was travelling and my kids loved them.  I was so happy to be able to order a case through Amazon.  We just finished our final box and my kids want to know what flavor we're going to order next.  Thanks for making it so easy to purchase!

As our mornings are hectic, it's great that I can grab an organic breakfast for my boys to eat on the run.  They do not taste like regular "Pop-Tarts", but we all really like them and will keep them stocked in our pantry.
Recommended.  Good price when bought in bulk.
These are delicious! They are much better and much better for you and the planet than more processed alternatives.

These are great!  Excellent alternative to p**t****.  All time favorite flavor is the Brown Sugar Maple, but the pink frosting on the Wildberry ones make them a closer second runner-up.  Husband also really loves the chocolate ones ... they make a great sweet treat.

Have really like the Nature's Path Organic Toaster Pastries since I first found them in the grocery store. Getting them from Amazon is even better, because they are much cheaper. Amazon could do a better job packing them I think.

Nature's Path could also offer a variety pack too for sell on Amazon.

We've been on a pomegranate kick lately and my wife saw these Organic `Toaster Pastries' (don't call them Pop-Tarts) and snatched them up the other day.  She's been looking for a healthier breakfast pastry for the kids since Pop-Tarts, while delicious, are not really all that great for you (with all the artificial colors, hydrogenated oils and such).  These organic pastries are really good and taste pretty much exactly like a Pop-Tart, they even look just like them.  I won't take that step and say that they taste `better', but they taste pretty much the same.  The Cherry Pomegranate flavor is really good, although I would have like more pomegranates.  Instead, I get a lot of cherry.  That is the only reason I give this four stars instead of five.  If you put a flavor on the box, you should represent that flavor well in the pastry and these should have merely been called `Cherry' because that is the only flavor I get.  Still, as a whole you can't go wrong with these Organic pastries.  They are more expensive than your typical Pop-Tarts, and you get less in a box as well, but for peace of mind as a parent they are worth it.

For anyone that has never ate these, you're mind will be blown! Especially if you been eating such brands as Pop Tarts which use artificial flavors, colors, preservatives, and GMOs worst of all! These taste better and are better for you!They are made with REAL INGREDIENTS and I feel sorry for those who have never tried these and continue to eat the other brands. YOU ARE MISSING OUT! Its a win win situation with these. It'd be nice to buy them here, but keep in mind, other than grocery stores and health food stores I've found them at Walmart too. You can find them many places. Natures Path is one of the best organic companies too on top of that. Great to support.

I saw these at Big Lots for two bucks a box of six so I bought a few. I'm not one to buy stuff and eat this type of sugary snack on a regular basis (or at least I refuse to see myself as someone who does), but the organic label was interesting so I gave it a try. I suppose it helps me rationalize eating them if they are organic, because the more unhealthy and unnatural contents of the mainstream competitive products, in combination to the calories and sugar for this type of "food," is generally enough to dissuade me from buying them.

I have eaten Pop Tarts before, and these are every bit as good and tasty or better. I haven't eaten enough Pop Tarts to be really familar with the varieties and all that, but I think these Nature's Path Organic Toaster Pastries are not lacking in any way at all compared to my recollection of the artificial and non-organic/natural conventional products. These were not dry or bland or stale or anything like that. The only drawback at all I could find with them is the calories and sugar content.

The one that I tried is the strawberry frosted style. If I see more at Big Lots, I'll be picking up some more.

First, I'd agree with everyone here who says this isn't a "healthy" food. Because it's really not. Lots of sugar in this. But as a snack, it sure beats a lot of the other sugary treats out there, and it tastes good enough, that your kids won't feel deprived if you give them this instead of a twinky. We also like that it's organic, since we have some issues with GMO foods- allergy type issues, not philosophical issues (not that there's anything wrong with philosophical issues, but ours is a true allergy).

And if you want to be really decadent, when you go camping, you can toast marshmallows, and toast these (or not toast them) and use them to make a pretty darn good smore-like creation.

What I like about this product:

- made with better ingredients
- frosted but not too sweet

Admit it, we all love pop tarts but those things have way too many unnecessary ingredients and sugar. I was so happy Nature's Path provided an alternative. I love the acai flavor; it is not too sweet but still satisfying the need for a sweet tooth.
This is a great price for a healthy food for my kids!  Like the convenience of purchasing and scheduling deliveries when needed.
My family LOVED the Nature's Path Organic Toaster Pastries, Chocolate Flavor.  They had the organic whole grain goodness, with the taste of a delicious treat.

I absolutely love these, my kids love them too, lol. All the flavors are good with the exception of those chocolate ones (but I wasn't a chocolate pop tart fan either- but even them weren't bad just better to us cold, not hot). Either way these are one of the best and from one who could live on pop tarts in less healthier times is more content that this is a much better substitute. Not only are they organic, but they dont contain any artificial "icks". Bear in mind these types of foods are not for people who are trying to lose weight.
